description: The name of the database that includes the data of bees or hoverflies.
Name of the institution in charge of data management.
example: Laboratory of Zoology, University of Mons (UMONS)

description: Name of the projects that have funded the curation process.
Year of the last database update.
Name of the dataset.
Entity or person who provide the dataset.
Entity or person who produce the dataset.
Creative Common license providing information concerning official permission to use the database.
An unique identifier for the data.
Author credited for the description of the species (scientificName) and the year of publication.
The name of the order to which the species belongs.
The name of the family to which the species belongs.
The name of the subfamily to which the species belongs.
The name of the tribe to which the species belongs.
The name of the genus to which the species belongs.
The name of the subgenus to which the species belongs.
The scientific name of the infraspecific epithet, which corresponds to the third part of the scientific name, is used to classify a rank below species such as a subspecies or variety.
The full binomial name of a species, consisting of a combination of the genus name and the specific epithet.
The maximum number of individuals recorded. If no range is specified, individualCountEnd is used as the default.
The minimum number of individuals recorded, used when a range is provided to indicate uncertainty in the count.
The sex of the individual(s) represented in the data.
unit: F (female); M (male); W (worker); H (hermaphrodite); Q (queen); I (male of social bees); U (unindentified)

description: The ending date of the interval during which the event  was recorded. If no range is specified, eventDateEnd is used by default.
The starting date of the interval during which the event was recorded, used when a range is specified to indicate the earliest possible date of the event.
The latest year of the interval during which the event was recorded. If no range is specified, yearEnd is used by default.
The latest month of the interval during which the event was recorded. If no range is specified, monthEnd is used by default.
The latest day of the interval during which the event was recorded. If no range is specified, dayEnd is used by default.
The earliest year of the interval during which the event was recorded, used when a range is specified.
The earliest month of the interval during which the event was recorded, used when a range is specified.
The earliest day of the interval during which the event was recorded, used when a range is specified.
The name of the country in which the record occurs.
The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the event occurs.
The name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the event occurs.
The original textual description of the place.
example: Bariloche, 25 km NNE via Ruta Nacional 40 (=Ruta 237)

description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees) of the data. Positive values are north of the Equator.
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees) of the data. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it.

The maximum horizontal distance (in meters) representing the uncertainty around the provided coordinates. If no range is specified, coordinateUncertaintyInMetersEnd is used by default.Leave blank if the uncertainty is unknown.

The minimum horizontal distance (in meters) representing the uncertainty around the provided coordinates, used when a range is specified to indicate the smallest possible uncertainty. Leave blank if the uncertainty is unknown.
Indicating whether the coordinates were manually georeferenced from the verbatimLocality.
